less O

iodine O

can O

disproportionated O
, O
insulating O
P21/n O
structure O
occurs O
if O
Nd O
is O
small O
enough O
, O
but O
if O
Nd O
is O
too O
large O
, O
even O
a O
very O
large O
U O
will O
not O
drive O
a O
structural O
or O
metal O
- O
insulator O
transition O
. O

section 18
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1409.4135v1.Computing_total_energies_in_complex_materials_using_charge_self_consistent_DFT_DMFT.pdf.json
We O
also O
note O
that O
the O
Nd O
predicted O
by O
DFT O
calculations O
is O
far O
from O
the O
value O
required O
to O
drive O
the O
transition O
, O
again O
indicating O
the O
importance O
of O
an O
appropriate O
double O
counting O
. O

section 18
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1409.4135v1.Computing_total_energies_in_complex_materials_using_charge_self_consistent_DFT_DMFT.pdf.json
The O
phase O
diagram O
in O

. O
9 O
provides O
an O
important O

on O

importance O
of O
fixing O

double O
counting O
correction O
in O
correlated O
materials O
. O

INTRODUCTION O
Orthovanadates O
with O
composition O
AVO4 O
( O
A O
= O
trivalent O
metal O
) O
with O
pentavalent O
vanadium O
are O
found O
in O
numerous O
applications O
due O
to O
their O
interesting O
magnetic O
, O
optical O
, O
and O
electronic O
properties O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-7.pdf.json
In O
addition O
to O
their O
wide O
practical O
applicability O
, O
these O
materials O
are O
also O
commonly O
used O
as O
cathodoluminescent O
materials O
, O
thermophosphors O
, O
scintillators O
, O
photocatalysis O
materials O
, O
and O
in O
lithium O
ion O
batteries O
. O
1 O
, O
2 O
As O
a O
consequence O
of O
the O
many O
applications O
of O
orthovanadates O
in O
recent O
years O
they O
have O
been O
extensively O
investigated O
under O
high O
pressure O
( O
HP O
) O
, O
like O
other O
ABO4 O
compounds O
, O
in O
order O
to O
understand O
their O
mechanical O
properties O
and O
HP O
structural O
phase O
transitions O
. O
3 O
ScVO4 B-MATERIAL
crystallizes O
in O
the O
tetragonal O
zircon O
- O
type O
structure O
( O
space B-STRUCTURE
group I-STRUCTURE
I41/amd I-STRUCTURE
, O
Z O
= O
2 O
) O
at O
ambient O
conditions O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-7.pdf.json
In O
this O
structure O
, O
the O
vanadium O
atom O
is O
tetrahedrally O
coordinated O
while O
the O
trivalent O
metal O
is O
coordinated O
to O
eight O
oxygen O
atoms O
. O
4 O
Recent O
x O
- O
ray O
diffraction O
( O
XRD O
) O
measurements O
on O
ScVO4 B-MATERIAL
have O
shown O
the O
onset O
of O
a O
nonreversible O
structural O
phase O
transition O
from O
the O
low O
- O
pressure O
zircon O
- O
type O
structure O
to O
a O
denser O
scheelite O
- O
type O
structure O
( O
space O
group O
I41/a O
, O
Z O
= O
4 O
) O
at O
8 O
. O
7 O
GPa O
. O
5 O
Ab O
initio O
calculations O
confirmed O
this O
transition O
( O
at O
5 O
. O
8 O
GPa O
) O
and O
predicted O
the O
existence O
of O
a O
second O
one O
at O
9 O
GPa O
. O
6 O
In O
contrast O
, O
XRD O
measurements O
found O
the O
scheelitetype O
structure O
to O
be O
stable O
up O
to O
27 O
GPa O
. O

section 0

DOI O
: O
10 O
. O
1103/PhysRevB O
. O
86 O
. O
014102 O
PACS O
number O
( O

) O
: O
71 O

I O
. O
INTRODUCTION O
Scintillators O
are O
an O
important O
class O
of O
materials O
that O
can O
emit O
light O
when O
excited O
by O
radiation O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
This O
property O
leads O
to O
the O
use O
of O
scintillators O
as O
means O
of O
detecting O
x O
- O
and O
γ O
- O
rays O
and O
neutrons O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Scintillator O
materials O
are O
widely O
used O
today O
in O
areas O
such O
as O
nonproliferation O
of O
special O
nuclear O
materials O
, O
homeland O
security O
, O
medical O
imaging O
, O
and O
highenergy O
physics O
. O
1 O
Scintillators O
are O
also O
used O
to O
generate O
light O
in O
fluorescence O
tubes O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
A O
scintillator O
material O
can O
absorb O
radiation O
energy O
through O
the O
excitation O
of O
electrons O
and O
holes O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
These O
electrons O
and O
holes O
can O
recombine O
and O
emit O
photons O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Efficient O
scintillation O
is O
often O
facilitated O
by O
impurities O
or O
so O
- O
called O
activators O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
This O
usually O
requires O
the O
diffusion O
of O
radiation O
- O
generated O
electrons O
and O
holes O
to O
the O
activators O
, O
where O
the O
radiative O
recombination O
occurs O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
However O
, O
competing O
processes O
such O
as O
nonradiative O
recombination O
or O
trapping O
at O
lattice O
defects O
may O
hinder O
the O
diffusion O
of O
electrons O
and O
holes O
to O
the O
activators O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Moreover O
, O
the O
free O
electrons O
and O
holes O
may O
be O
unstable O
against O
self O
- O
trapping O
, O
thereby O
creating O
polarons O
and O
self O
- O
trapped O
excitons O
( O
STEs O
) O
, O
2 O
whose O
diffusion O
depends O
on O
their O
migration O
barriers O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
Trapping O
of O
electrons O
and O
holes O
at O
the O
activators O
is O
due O
to O
the O
presence O
of O
electronic O
gap O
states O
induced O
by O
the O
activator O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-14.pdf.json
In O
the O
case O
of O
Ce O
- O
doped O
scintillators O
, O
the O
Ce O
4f O
and O
5d O
levels O
need O
to O
be O

at O
the O
projected O
bulk O
Dirac O
point O
along O
the O
- O
M O
direction O
( O
marked O
by O
the O
blue O
arrow O
) O
. O

section 2
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
These O
are O
the O
symmetry O
- O
protected O
topological O
surface O
states O
[20] O
. O

section 2
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
The O
other O
surface O
states O
, O
for O
instance O
, O
the O
surface O
states O
above O
the O
Fermi O
level O
at O
X O
in O
the O
surface O

, O
do O
not O
conflate O
with O
the O
bulk O
continuum O
at O
the O
bulk O
Dirac O
point O
. O

section 2
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
We O
thus O
deduce O
that O
the O
other O
surface O
states O
are O
normal O
surface O
states O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
The O
type O
- O
II O
Dirac O
semimetals O
predicted O
in O
this O
study O
have O
many O
advantages O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
First O
, O
due O
to O
the O
Fm3m O
symmetry O
of O
their O
face O
- O

- O

( O

primitive O
cells O
( O

. O

) O
, O
there O
are O

Dirac O
- O

pairs O
in O

BZ O
of O

YPd2Sn B-MATERIAL

families O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

Dirac O
points O

after O
surface O
projection O
and O

to O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

of O

all O

to O
the O

level O
( O

I O
) O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json
Especially O
, O
the O
Dirac O
- O
point O
energy O
of O
YPd2Sn B-MATERIAL
is O
just O
129 O
meV O
above O
the O

level O
, O

when O

constants O
are O

3% O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

the O

level O
with O
a O

, O

angle O
- O

chiral O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

[34] O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/18-09-2019-paper-1.pdf.json

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json
I O
. O
INTRODUCTION O
HEUSLER O
alloys O
of O
composition O
X2YZ O
, O
where O
X O
and O
Yare O
transition O
metal O
elements O
and O
Z O
is O
a O
main O
group O
element O
, O
exhibit O
technologically O
useful O
properties O
such O
as O
high O
spin O
polarization O
at O
the O
Fermi O
level O
and O
high O
Curie O
temperatures O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json
These O
properties O
are O
particularly O
relevant O
in O
the O
development O
of O
spintronic O
devices O
such O
as O
magnetic O
tunneling O
junctions O
[1] O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json
While O
half O
- O
metallic O
ferromagnetism O
frequently O
occurs O
in O
Heusler O
compounds O
in O
which O
X O
= O
Co O
, O
ferrimagnetism O
is O
common O
in O
Heusler O
compounds O
having O
X O
= O
Mn O
, O
such O
as O
Mn2VAl O
and O
Mn2CoGa O
[2] O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json
Heusler O
compounds O
are O
very O
versatile O
and O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
display O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
other O
intriguing O
properties O
such O
as O

transformations O
and O
superparamagnetism O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json

transformations O
have O
the O
potential O
to O
exhibit O
the O
magnetic O
shape O
memory O
effect O
, O
which O
can O
be O
exploited O
in O
sensors O
and O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json

well O
- O

example O
is O
Ni2MnGa O
[3] O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/08-06-2019-paper-8.pdf.json

structural O
transitions O
are O
often O
accompanied O
by O
magnetic O
transitions O
that O
go O
beyond O

and O

and O

- O
glass O
effects O

, O
[5] O
. O

section TITLE
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part2-1108.1294v1.Ferromagnetic_spin_coupling_of_2p_impurities_in_band_insulators_stabilized_by_intersite_Coulomb_interaction_Nitrogen_doped_MgO.pdf.json

of O

- I-MATERIAL

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part2-1108.1294v1.Ferromagnetic_spin_coupling_of_2p_impurities_in_band_insulators_stabilized_by_intersite_Coulomb_interaction_Nitrogen_doped_MgO.pdf.json
For O
a O
nitrogen O
dimer O
in O
insulating O
MgO O
, O
a O
ferromagnetic O
coupling O
between O
spin O
- O
polarized O
2p O
- O
holes O
is O
revealed O
by O
calculations O
based O
on O
the O
density O
functional O
theory O
amended O
by O
an O
on O
- O
site O
Coulomb O
interaction O
and O
corroborated O
by O
the O
Hubbard O
model O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part2-1108.1294v1.Ferromagnetic_spin_coupling_of_2p_impurities_in_band_insulators_stabilized_by_intersite_Coulomb_interaction_Nitrogen_doped_MgO.pdf.json
It O
is O
shown O
that O
the O
ferromagnetic O
coupling O
is O
facilitated O
by O
a O
T O
- O
shaped O
orbital O
arrangement O
of O
the O
2p O
- O
holes O
, O
which O
is O
in O
its O
turn O
controlled O
by O
an O
intersite O
Coulomb O
interaction O
due O
to O
the O
directionality O
of O
the O
p O
- O
orbitals O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part2-1108.1294v1.Ferromagnetic_spin_coupling_of_2p_impurities_in_band_insulators_stabilized_by_intersite_Coulomb_interaction_Nitrogen_doped_MgO.pdf.json
We O
thus O
conjecture O
that O
this O
interaction O
is O
an O
important O
ingredient O
of O
ferromagnetism O
in O
band O
insulators O

affects O
all O
oxides O
where O
magnetism O
is O
due O
to O
p O
- O
electrons O
or O
defects O
in O
the O
p O
- O
electron O
systems O
. O

rather O
than O
a O
linear O
function O
. O

section 3
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1603.01714v3.Enhancement_of_the_spin_transfer_torque_efficiency_in_magnetic_STM_junctions.pdf.json

, O
we O
have O

. O

( O
A1 O
) O

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/28-09-2019-5a.pdf.json
Since O

- O

alloy O

was O

to O
be O
a O
half O
- O

( O

) O

first O

in O
1983 O

, O
half O
- O

, O

one O

direction O
is O

is O

, O
have O
always O
received O
the O
theoretical O
and O
experimental O
attention O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/09-02-2020-1210.5820v2.Synthesized_inverse_perovskites_Sc3InX_X_B_C_N_A_theoretical_investigation.pdf.json

, O
and O
therefore O
, O
we O
only O
make O
a O
few O
relevant O
remarks O
. O

section 10
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Here O
again O
we O
take O
the O
critical O
point O
to O
be O
at O
x O
= O
0 O
. O
5 O
, O
break O
the O
inversion O
symmetry O
by O
considering O
an O
ordered O
phase O
with O
layers O
in O
the O
sequence O
Tl O
- O
Te O
- O
Bi O
- O
S O
, O
and O
compute O
the O
band O
structure O
for O
a O
series O
of O
c/a O
values O
. O

section 10
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
The O
results O
, O
summarized O
in O
Fig O
. O
10 O
, O
show O
that O
at O
c/a O
= O
4 O
. O
93 O
there O
is O
a O
direct O
band O
gap O
of O
0 O
. O
123 O
eV O
along O
- O
L O
, O
although O
there O
is O
an O
indirect O
gap O
of O
≈10 O
meV O
. O
At O
the O
critical O
value O
of O
c/a O
= O
5 O
. O
00 O
, O
the O
gap O
becomes O
0 O
along O
- O
L O
at O
k O
= O
( O
0 O
. O
0 O
, O
0 O
. O
0 O
, O
0 O
. O
025 O
) O
, O
even O
though O
the O
gap O
remains O
finite O
at O
, O
with O
a O
value O
of O
0 O
. O
210 O
eV O
. O
With O
a O
further O
increase O
in O
c/a O
, O
the O
gap O
reopens O
and O
becomes O
0 O
. O
221 O
eV O
at O
c/a O
= O
5 O
. O
57 O
. O

section 10
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Adiabatic O
continuity O
arguments O
combined O
with O
the O
change O
in O
the O
orbital O
character O
of O
the O
bulk O
valence O
and O
conduction O
bands O
at O
the O
critical O
value O
of O
c/a O
then O
allow O
us O
to O
conclude O
the O
nontrivial O
- O
to O
- O
trivial O
insulator O
transition O
shown O
in O
Fig O
. O
10 O
( O
a O
) O
. O

section 10
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
As O
for O
the O
Weyl O
semimetal O
phase O
, O
at O
the O
critical O
c/a O
value O
, O
TlBi O
( O
S1-xTex O
) O
2 O
displays O
six O
Weyl O
points O
along O
the O
- O
L O
direction O
, O
at O
k O
= O
( O
0 O
. O
0 O
, O
0 O
. O
0 O
, O
0 O
. O
025 O
) O
, O
although O
the O
spin O
splitting O
is O
larger O
than O
in O
TlBi O
( O
S1-xSex O
) O
2 O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
We O
have O
carried O
out O
an O
ab O
initio O
study O
of O
bulk O
and O
surface O
electronic O
structures O
of O
six O
thallium O
- O
based O
III O
- O
V O
- O
VI2 O
ternary O
chalcogenides O
TlMQ2 O
, O
where O
M O
= O
Bi O
or O
Sb O
and O
Q O
= O
S O
, O
Se O
, O
or O
Te O
, O
with O
the O
focus O
on O
delineating O
the O
topological O
nature O
of O
these O
compounds O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
TlBiTe2 O
is O
found O
to O
be O
a O
semimetal O
with O
a O
band O
gap O
of O
-10 O
meV O
, O
while O
the O
other O
five O
Tl O
compounds O
are O
all O
small O
- O
band O
- O
gap O
semiconductors O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Based O
on O
an O
analysis O
of O
parities O
of O
bulk O
band O
structures O
, O
we O
predict O
that O
TlSbSe2 O
, O
TlSbTe2 O
, O
TlBiSe2 O
, O
and O
TlBiTe2 O
are O
nontrivial O
topological O
insulators O
with O
band O
inversion O
at O
the O
point O
, O
but O
TlSbS2 O
and O
TlBiS2 O
are O
trivial O
band O
insulators O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Moreover O
, O
surface O
- O
state O
computations O
show O
that O
the O
surface O
Dirac O
states O
lie O
in O
the O
gap O
region O
at O
the O
point O
in O
all O
four O
aforementioned O
topological O
compounds O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Our O
predicted O
topological O
phases O
and O
the O
point O
centered O
Dirac O
- O
cone O
surface O
states O
are O
in O
substantial O
accord O
with O
available O
ARPES O
results O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Electronic O
structures O
of O
slabs O
with O
different O
numbers O
of O
layers O
were O
computed O
in O
order O
to O
gain O
insight O
into O
thickness O
- O
dependent O
effects O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
The O
gap O
opens O
at O
the O
Dirac O
point O
for O
thin O
slabs O
and O
decreases O
with O
increasing O
thickness O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Finally O
, O
we O
investigated O
TlBi O
( O
S1-xSex O
) O
2 O
and O
TlBi O
( O
S1-xTex O
) O
2 O
alloys O
for O
x O
= O
0 O
. O
5 O
, O
where O
the O
inversion O
symmetry O
was O
explicitly O
broken O
by O
using O
layers O
in O
the O
sequence O
Tl O
- O
Se O
( O
Te O
) O
- O
Bi O
- O
S O
and O
the O
c/a O
ratio O
was O
varied O
. O

section 11
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-35.pdf.json
Both O
alloys O
were O
found O
to O
undergo O
a O
topological O
transition O
at O
a O
critical O
value O
of O
c/a O
at O
which O
the O
spin O
degeneracy O
of O
the O
Dirac O
states O
is O
lifted O
and O
a O
Weyl O
semimetal O
phase O
can O
be O

with O
six O
Weyl O
points O
in O
the O
bulk O
Brillouin O
zone O
located O
along O
the O
- O
L O
directions O
. O

of O
description O
that O
our O
theory O
gives O
. O

section 16
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-34.pdf.json
In O
particular O
, O
we O
find O
an O
enhancement O
of O
the O
polarization O
at O
the O
surface O
for O
which O
the O
polarization O
points O
inward O
, O

the O
polarization O
is O
reduced O
when O
the O
spontaneous O
polarization O
points O
outward O
. O

section 16
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-34.pdf.json
We O
have O
also O
detailed O
the O
variations O
in O
these O
surface O
relaxations O
as O
the O
polarization O
of O
the O
slab O
is O
modified O
by O
an O
external O

field O
. O

section 16
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-34.pdf.json

order O
to O
obtain O
an O
even O
more O
realistic O
level O
of O
description O

next O

step O

to O
calculate O
the O
influence O
of O
a O
real O
metal/perovskite O
interface O
on O

atomic O
relaxations O

the O
polarization O

section 16
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-34.pdf.json

such O

study O

overlayer O

particular O
epitaxy O
conditions O

is O
thus O

less O
universal O
. O

section 16
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/04-09-2019-paper-34.pdf.json

. O

. O

- O
307X/34/1/016101 O

- O

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1501.02794v2.Ab_initio_construction_of_magnetic_phase_diagrams_in_alloys_The_case_of_Fe___1_x_Mn__x_Pt.pdf.json
In O
its O
basic O
features O
, O
our O
implementation O
[S1] O
of O
the O
coherent O
potential O
approximation O
( O
CPA B-METHOD
) O
follows O
the O
formulation O
[S2] O
based O
on O
iterating O
the O
``coherent O
interactor'' O
matrix O
Ω O
for O
sites O
with O
chemical O
and/or O
spin O
disorder O
, O
which O
is O
defined O
as O
Ω O
( O
z O
) O
= O
P O
( O
z O
) O
- O
g-1 O
( O
z O
) O
, O
( O
1 O
) O
where O
z O
is O
the O
complex O
energy O
, O
P O
is O
the O
coherent O
potential O
and O
g O
the O
on O
- O
site O
auxiliary O
Green’s O
function O
. O

section 1
id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1501.02794v2.Ab_initio_construction_of_magnetic_phase_diagrams_in_alloys_The_case_of_Fe___1_x_Mn__x_Pt.pdf.json
The O
latter O
is O
computed O
as O
the O
on O
- O
site O
block O
of O
the O
k O
- O
integrated O
crystal O
Green’s O
function O
g O
( O
k O
) O
= O
[PBδBB′ O
- O
S O
BB′ O
( O
k O
) O
]-1 O
, O
where O
B O
and O
B′ O
denote O
basis O
sites O
within O
the O
unit O
cell O
, O
and O
S O
is O
the O
structure O
constant O
matrix O
of O

id data_09-04-2020/fold5/test/29-01-2020-part1-1310.4004v1.Role_of_resonant_inelastic_x_ray_scattering_in_high_resolution_core_level_spectroscopy_of_actinide_materials.pdf.json

at O
